Arbor SP Data Sheet

Digital Library Fulfillment Center

The document you requested, Arbor SP Data Sheet, is ready.

Who Relies on NETSCOUT

NETSCOUT has established the Technology Alliance Program to collaborate with best-in-class technology partners, and enable Channel Resellers to promote and deliver our industry-leading Smart Data solutions.

Jeff Levinson

As Senior Vice President and General Counsel, and Secretary, Jeff Levinson is responsible for the company's global legal strategy legal operations. He plays a strategic role in achieving corporate goals, leading the legal team in support of corporate initiatives, and supporting charitable and community drives.

Our Mission

At NETSCOUT, we transform and accelerate the way our customers deliver, deploy, and secure services and applications across physical, virtual, and cloud environments.

NETSCOUT Smart Data

Today’s world runs on data, and our ability to distill real-time, precise intelligence from the chaos of unstructured traffic sets us apart. While we live in a data-driven world, most companies struggle to extract full value from that data.

Connected for Good

We have a long tradition of supporting our communities through various charitable activities and contributions. Our employee Guardians, through their passion and desire to help those in need, are at the center of this effort.

Tony King

Tony King is NETSCOUT’s Senior Vice President, Worldwide Sales for the Arbor Security Business Unit and has overseen the sales organization since 2013. Mr. King is responsible for directing all the business unit’s global sales on both service provider and enterprise markets

Bruce Kelley, Jr.

Bruce Kelley, Jr. is NETSCOUT's Senior Vice President, Chief Technology Officer, Service Provider. Mr. Kelley plays a lead role in setting the priorities and direction around product and service developments in the service provider business.

Daryle DeBalski

Daryle DeBalski is Senior Vice President, Product Operations. He joined NETSCOUT in July 2015 after NETSCOUT's acquisition of Danaher's Communications Business where he was general manager for the Fluke Networks Enterprise business unit.

John W. Downing

John W. Downing is NETSCOUT’s Executive Vice President, Worldwide Sales Operations and has overseen the Company's sales operations since 2007. In this role, Mr. Downing is responsible for directing the Company’s sales leadership in both the service provider and enterprise markets.

Jean Bua

Jean Bua has served as NETSCOUT's Chief Financial Officer and Treasurer since November 2011. She joined the company in September 2010 as Vice President, Finance, in conjunction with the company’s succession planning.

Michael Szabados

Michael Szabados has served as NETSCOUT's Chief Operating Officer since April 2007. In this role, Mr. Szabados has focused on implementing and executing the company's vision and strategy.

Michael Szabados

Michael Szabados was appointed to NETSCOUT’s Board of Directors and named Vice Chairman of the Board in February 2019. He has served as NETSCOUT’s Chief Operating Officer since April 2007, focusing on the implementation and execution of the Company’s vision and strategy.
Cloud Smarter

Anil Singhal

Anil Singhal co-founded NETSCOUT in June 1984 and has served as NETSCOUT’s Chief Executive Officer and as a director on the Company’s Board since inception. In January 2007, Mr. Singhal was appointed Chairman of the Board and has been serving as NETSCOUT’s President, CEO, and Chairman.

The Business of Botnets

The Mirai attacks against Dyn in 2016 drew widespread attention to botnets. Yet compared to how cybercriminals are using botnets today, the Dyn attacks may come to seem rather amateurish.

Arbor DDoS

NETSCOUT provides powerful DDoS protection and network visibility solutions backed by unmatched global threat intelligence.
ST. LOUIS VMUG USERCON

Availability is Everything

With the increase in multi-vector attacks, security experts agree that reducing the risk from DDoS attacks requires a defense-in-depth or layered approach utilizing multiple, synchronized mitigation approaches.

The Tiger Effect, 2.0?

The Masters kicks off today and by far the biggest story in Augusta Georgia this year is the unlikely comeback of Tiger Woods. He is, by far, the most important person in the sport. How excited are golf fans at the thought of his return?

Thank You - Get Future Smarter

Thank you for your interest. We will reach out to you shortly.

Innaput Actors Utilize Remote Access Trojan Since 2016, Presumably Targeting Victim Files

Overview

ASERT recently identified a campaign targeting commercial manufacturing  in the US and potentially Europe in late 2017.   The threat actors used phishing and downloader(s) to install a Remote Access Trojan (RAT) ASERT calls InnaputRAT on the target's machine.&nbs

The Six Phases of a DDoS Incident Response Plan

Any enterprise that interacts with its customers and stakeholders online — which is just about everyone these days — needs to have robust defenses to detect and mitigate distributed denial of service (DDoS) attacks.

PFS Infographic - SANS Network Security Survey Findings

In its latest network security survey, SANS Institute uncovered the challenges that introduce risks to the network. This infographic highlights the key areas of concern—and what can be done to address them.

Unlock Optimized Active Security

The threat landscape is always changing, and security solutions must be able to keep up. For most, a network packet broker can help. But how do you know if a solution is right for you?

Case Study: Service Provider Expands Visibility

The IT team needed to find an effective monitoring solution that could provide pervasive visibility into network traffic for service assurance. Top-notch performance requirements and stringent budget parameters were the key considerations.

NETSCOUT Brings Virtual Network Visibility to State Insurer

This State agency uses a heavily trafficked public Web portal to help deliver its Workers Compensation insurance services to small- and medium-sized employers.

Healthcare Agency Supports Critical Patient-care Services

For this healthcare agency, ensuring that health organizations and providers have “always on” access to networks and applications, such as lab results and digital imaging, is vitally important to the quality of care. The IT team wanted to ensure its new electronic health record system and data centers offered flawless network connectivity for hundreds of patient care providers.

Automation Puts Time on Your Side During a DDoS Attack

During a DDoS attack, time is unforgiving. A few seconds can mean the difference between a successful mitigation and costly network downtime. Anything that accelerates your mean time to detect (MTTD) and respond (MTTR) to an attack is to your advantage.

DDoS Defense: The Need For Speed – Arbor Networks

In DDoS defense, speed is critical. Unlike malware which can lie dormant within an organization for months, massive “fast flood” attacks can materialize in an instant and ramp up to hundreds of gigabits in a matter of seconds.

Achieve Unified Packet Visibility at Scale

Panda Banker Zeros in on Japanese Targets

Key Findings

  • A threat actor using the well-known banking malware Panda Banker (a.k.a Zeus Panda, PandaBot) has started targeting financial institutions in Japan.
  • Based on our data and analysis this is the first time that we have seen Panda Banker injects targeting Japan

DDoS Managed Service

Among the options available for protection against DDoS attacks, some enterprises turn to content delivery networks or CDNs — globally distributed networks serving web content such as streaming video to end users.

The Consequences of DDoS Attacks are Rising

What is at risk in a DDoS attack on an enterprise website or network? Certainly, there is a financial risk, as revenue will likely be lost as a direct result of the attack. There is the cost of remediation, and affected customers may have to be compensated.
